Description: Large, flat shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: frieze of short vertical tongues, some in added red, between bands at top of shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of antithetic ram and panther (head of ram with red eye and part of snout in added white, to right; head, minus left ear, of panther with red and white eyes and forehead, to left); below, part of incised leaf with added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87, pl. X, no. 7.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.026) (Phase 1)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 62, pl. VIII, no. 3)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.22)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
